ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six traveled by appointment with nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.3_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.4_0: “Just as we walk about with our wives, so these Sakyan ascetics walk about by appointment with nuns.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.5_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.6_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.7_0: “How can the monks from the group of six travel by appointment with nuns?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.11_0: “... Foolish men, how can you travel by appointment with nuns?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.13_0: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.14.1_0: ‘If a monk travels by appointment with a nun, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.15_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.1_0: Soon afterwards a number of monks and nuns were traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.2_0: The nuns said to the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.4_0: “Sisters, it’s not allowable for us to travel by appointment with nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.5_0: that you go first or will go.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.8_0: But because the nuns went behind, they were robbed and raped by bandits.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.9_0: When they arrived at Sāvatthī, they told the nuns there what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.10_0: The nuns then told the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.11_0: They in turn told the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.12_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.13_0: “Monks, I allow you to travel by appointment with a nun if it’s a risky and dangerous road that should be traveled with a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.14_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.15.1_0: ‘If a monk travels by appointment with a nun, even just to the next village, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.16_0: This is the appropriate occasion: the road is considered risky and dangerous and should be traveled with a group.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.6_0: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.10_2: If he makes an appointment like this: the monk says, “Let’s go,” and he replies, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.11_0: Even just to the next village:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.12_0: when the villages are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next village he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.13_0: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.14_0: Except if it is an appropriate occasion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.15_0: unless it is an appropriate occasion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.16_0: The road should be traveled with a group:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.17_0: it is not possible to travel without a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.19_0: a place where criminals are camped, eating, standing, sitting, or lying down has been seen along that road.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.21_0: criminals have been seen along that road, injuring, robbing, or beating people. If they go thinking it is dangerous, but then see that it is not, the nuns are to be dismissed, “Go, Sisters.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.1_0: If there is an appointment, and he perceives that there is, and he travels with a nun, even just to the next village, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.2_0: If there is an appointment, but he is unsure of it, and he travels with a nun, even just to the next village, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.3_0: If there is an appointment, but he perceives that there is not, and he travels with a nun, even just to the next village, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.4_0: If the monk makes an appointment, but the nun does not express her agreement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.5_0: If there is no appointment, but he perceives that there is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.6_0: If there is no appointment, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.7_0: If there is no appointment, and he perceives that there is not, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.3.3_0: if he goes without an appointment;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.3.4_0: if the nun has made an appointment, but he has not expressed his agreement;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.3.5_0: if they go, but not according to the appointment;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.3.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.3.9_0: The seventh rule, the training rule on appointments, is finished.
